title: Ticket #5441: Standardize/unify timestamp to user-readable date code
description:
Right now we have at least two places (_format_global_header() in condor_utils/dprintf.cpp and debug_cache_insert() in condor_dagman/debug.cpp) that produce a user-readable date/time string (and I'll bet there are others I don't know about). (And I'm going to at least temporarily be adding another one for #5439.)

I think it would make sense to create a stand-alone function that any part of the HTCondor code can call, that takes a seconds-since-the-epoch timestamp and returns something like a MyString with a suitably-formatted string, taking into account all of the relevant config knobs.
remarks:
2015-Dec-15 13:24:37 by tannenba:
In our utils lib, see /src/condor_utils/format_time.cpp which will convert epoch time into several different human-readable formats; this is already used many places in htcondor including condor_status, condor_q, condor_history, etc.

And of course there is strftime() from C library

Perhaps abandon this ticket?

2015-Dec-15 16:00:15 by wenger:
But my point is that format_time.cpp and strftime() don't look at D_TIMESTAMP and D_SUB_SECOND.

(Maybe the problem is only in DAGMan, because we partially duplicate the dprintf date/time formatting when using the cache for the dagman.out file.)
creator: wenger
